title: Six Nations 2021: France 32-30 Wales highlights
description: Watch highlights from a dramatic match as France beat Wales in the dying seconds to end the visitors' Grand Slam hopes and keep alive their chances of winning the Six Nations title.

title: Covid-19: Have a million people left the UK?
description: How far has the UK's foreign-born population fallen during the coronavirus pandemic?

title: FA Cup quarter-finals: Leicester v Man Utd & Chelsea v Sheff Utd live on BBC TV
description: The FA Cup quarter-finals take place on Saturday and Sunday - with two matches live on BBC TV.

title: The dogs helping endangered Tasmanian devils find a mate
description: A world-first trial in Australia is using dogs to help the endangered species procreate.

title: FA Cup highlights: Everton 0-2 Manchester City
description: Watch highlights as late goals from Ilkay Gundogan and Kevin de Bruyne break Everton resistance at Goodison Park to send Manchester City into the FA Cup semi-finals.

title: Birmingham's Jewellery Quarter clock 'restored to former glory'
description: The chimes of the 118-year-old Jewellery Quarter clock are to ring out for the first time in 30 years.

title: Learning Welsh in lockdown... around the world
description: The coronavirus pandemic has sparked a rise in people wanting to learn a new language.

title: Women's safety: Police apologise over flasher response delay
description: April-Joy Serrant says she was told to wait two days for police to follow up a report of a flasher.

title: White cliffs memorial planned for Dame Vera Lynn
description: The singer's family wants to put a sculpture of Dame Vera looking out over the English Channel.

title: Newtownabbey: Murder investigation launched after three found dead
description: Police believe a man stabbed his mother and girlfriend at separate properties before killing himself.

title: Covid-19: Hancock hails UK vaccine success after record day for jabs
description: The health secretary announces half of all adults in the UK have now received a first vaccine dose.

title: Tokyo 2020: No international fans at Olympics and Paralympics
description: No international fans will be permitted at the delayed 2020 Tokyo Olympics and Paralympics this summer because of the pandemic.

title: Covid: France and Poland increase lockdown measures as infections surge
description: Some 21 million people in France are affected, while in Poland shops and hotels are shut nationwide.

title: Covid: Summer holidays abroad 'unlikely', warns government adviser
description: There is a risk travellers could bring Covid variants back to the UK, a government adviser warns.

title: Leeds United great Peter Lorimer dies
description: Leeds United's all-time record goalscorer Peter Lorimer dies aged 74.

title: Icelandic volcano erupts near Reykjavik
description: Aerial footage shows lava snaking its way down after the eruption.

title: Mar-a-Lago: 'Covid outbreak' at Trump's Florida residence
description: Parts of the Mar-a-Lago resort, where the former US president lives, have reportedly been closed.

title: 'A spectacular symbol of a golden era at Leeds' - Peter Lorimer obituary
description: Peter Lorimer, who has died aged 74, will be remembered as one of the most explosive and influential members of the greatest side in Leeds United's history.

title: Covid: Plan unveiled to 'spruce up' coastal areas and high streets
description: Ministers hope extra money and easing of rules will help areas reopen safely as lockdown eases.

title: Thorntons closure: 'It was the place to get that Willy Wonka feeling'
description: After 110 years of trading on the high street Thorntons is closing its remaining 61 shops.

title: Covid-19 leaflets: How pandemic disinformation went offline
description: If you thought misleading coronavirus information was just circulating online - think again.

title: The Papers: Alarm over Europe's new wave and leaders 'on wanted list'
description: Boris Johnson is pictured on several front pages getting a first dose of the Oxford-AstraZeneca jab.

title: Six Nations 2021: Wales face France in Paris for Grand Slam in unfamiliar circumstances
description: Wales seek their fifth Grand Slam of the Six Nations era on Saturday but the experience will be very different from previous years.

title: Coronavirus: Protests should be allowed during lockdown, say 60 MPs and peers
description: Protests are not listed as a "reasonable excuse" for leaving home in current lockdown legislation.

title: Australia warned of 'life-threatening' flash floods
description: Dozens of people are rescued from floodwaters, as torrential rains batter the country's east coast.

title: The forgotten referendum of 2011
description: Why the referendum everyone's forgotten shaped the last decade of our lives.

title: Comic Relief 2021: Justin Bieber and Prince William lead Red Nose Day stars
description: And the Duke of Cambridge thanks the public for its "compassion and generosity" as over £45m is raised.

title: Why did Alibaba's Jack Ma disappear for three months?
description: Alibaba's Jack Ma appeared to fall out of favour after criticising China's regulators.

title: Coronavirus: How Russia glosses over its Covid death toll
description: The reality behind Russia's pandemic is most likely to be found in its excessive mortality rates.

title: Skylab: The myth of the mutiny in space
description: Did a crew sent to the US Skylab space station go on strike? The last surviving member says it's a myth that won't die.

title: Why is everyone fighting over the South China Sea?
description: China claims most of it but surrounding countries and the US disagree. The BBC's Zhaoyin Feng explains why.

title: What happened with the AstraZeneca vaccine?
description: Ros Atkins looks at how a vaccine hailed as a ‘game-changer’ has seen its reputation tarnished.

title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: A rare view inside the conflict zone
description: A BBC team gets a glimpse of the human cost of the recent fighting in Tigray.

title: Giving up alcohol: 'I feel like I’ve been reborn’
description: Nikki, a recovering alcoholic, describes how she stopped drinking during the pandemic and how it changed her.

title: Line Of Duty creator Jed Mercurio on the secret of the police drama's success
description: As it returns for a sixth series, Line of Duty creator Jed Mercurio says the show owes some of its success to word of mouth.
